title: If Gangplank lost his ship
body:
then where is his cannon barrage coming from?

this is bothering me more than it should.

replies.body:
[From Reddit user soundslikeponies](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3flazl/if_gankplank_lost_his_ship_where_is_his_ultimate/ctppl8w):

> <Gangplank> hm. I've lost a ship.. literally lost. it responds to cannon barrages, it works completely, I just can't figure out where in Runeterra it is.
Dont worry, they will just disable his ultimate for lore reasons.

> [{quoted}](name=Trebbi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-08-03T14:24:15.764+0000)
>
> Dont worry, they will just disable his ultimate for lore reasons.

or he probably just got a lesser ship and he uses the krakens you get ingame to upgrade it doesn't that make like 100% sense considering he probably just stole the lesser ship
Except for the part where he buys his thrown-into-the-sea cannon. Well, maybe he fished it out and... installment costs, or something...
If Gangplank had his original ship it would probably be pretty OP. Maybe even covering the entire screen with cannonballs.

He is still a pirate.

More than likely he simply seized another one.

> [{quoted}](name=Lane Cancer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-08-03T16:07:22.843+0000)
>
> He is still a pirate.
> 
> More than likely he simply seized another one.

But he doesnt have a crew to fire

Implying people wouldn't still be loyal to him 

People look at things far too one dimensionally these days..

> [{quoted}](name=Lane Cancer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=000500010000,timestamp=2015-08-04T00:27:06.246+0000)
>
> Implying people wouldn't still be loyal to him 
> 
> People look at things far too one dimensionally these days..

Then maybe that could be explained as well? He lost bilgewater, so I wouldnt think anyone was still with him after ya know having just come back from the dead

Dude its self implied.

Regardless of what happened, there will be  a portion of his crew that survived that is legitimately loyal to him.

Even more so that MF is hunting them down, rallying behind gp once more would be quite easy.

As someone else also stated, his Flagship was destroyed, not his entire armada. He could still have the Noxian War Gallon he stole for all we know.

> [{quoted}](name=Lane Cancer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-08-03T16:07:22.843+0000)
>
> He is still a pirate.
> 
> More than likely he simply seized another one.

He HAS other ones. His Flagship is toast though.

{{champion:41}}  and {{champion:223}}  made a deal with each other what {{champion:41}} desired most was his ship so made the deal and now his cannon barrage comes from {{champion:223}} mouth as he gave him his ship but ate it.

I now want to see an in-game interaction wherein Gangplank uses his ult and Tahm opens his mouth to let loose a volley of cannonballs every so often. 

I can't tell if that'd be disturbing or hilarious, but dammit I wanna see it.
llh I am laughing so hard I can't type. lol
i need an answer to this, riot.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-08-03T14:33:57.277+0000)
>
> i need an answer to this, riot.

They mention that his flagship, the _Dead Pool_, was destroyed.

They never mentioned _**anything**_ about the Noxian (Swain's to be specific) flagship, the _Leviathan_..

>the Dead Pool

Oh Riot...

_Leviathan_ makes me think of Scott Westerfeld.

 Just wanted to type something, sorry.
Just finished that series. Soooo much better than *Uglies*.
I haven't read the _Uglies_ series yet, but it's on my scope.  It's just... Damn! Leviathan was Great. I loved it.
*Uglies* was alright, but the world and the characters pale in comparison to *Leviathan*.
It makes me think of Leviathan. RIP Leviathan/Force of Nature Singed. D:

> [{quoted}](name=BlackSunNocturne,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-08-03T17:31:30.617+0000)
>
> They mention that his flagship, the _Dead Pool_, was destroyed.
> 
> They never mentioned _**anything**_ about the Noxian (Swain's to be specific) flagship, the _Leviathan_..

Isn't the Leviathan a giant, mechanical Airship?

> [{quoted}](name=James Stone,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=000200000002,timestamp=2015-08-04T17:21:33.673+0000)
>
> Isn't the Leviathan a giant, mechanical Airship?

They just said the _Leviathan_ is {{champion:50}}'s personal flagship. Nothing else about it is known aside from that, and Gangplank stealing it

_EXCUSE ME_?  Get your Clanker ass outta here.

It's actually a large Darwinist Beast made from the Life threads of countless other creatures, it's actually manufactured to be an Ecosystem. Of course, A Monkey Luddite like you wouldn't know that.

(These are jokes.)
Oh cmon, of course the cannonballs come out of the Gundam he has, together with his metal arm.
you know, I think that's actually a good answer.
He also threw Death's Daughter into the ocean, but he can apparently still upgrade his ult with it.

he's still got a boat:
http://img2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20130405083159/pirates/images/thumb/2/2c/AWEJacksDinghyProfile.jpg/500px-AWEJacksDinghyProfile.jpg
yes, the cannons are hidden under water
Way to steal this from reddit.

> [{quoted}](name=Renegade Angel95,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-08-03T18:50:09.939+0000)
>
> Way to steal this from reddit.

i dont even visit reddit. reddit sucks.

its a pretty obvious hole in the story, so im not surprised somebody else thought of it.
{{champion:41}} A good captain always keeps a backup.
so... GP is batman?
He lost _one_ of his ships.
His ult is actually the 21-cannon salute in honor of his fallen ship. True story.

I made a similar post but it never caught any speed.

The other thing that is bothering me about it is that you can also choose to have Death's Daughter fire in your ult.

I guess I could see GP getting a new smaller ship (since the tool tip doesn't say that he signals the Deadpool, just "his ship") without announcing the fact that he is still alive. But he kicked Death's Daughter, his prized cannon (most people who hold something they have above any other like it, wouldn't be quick to give it's name to another after it's passing) , overboard as an execution for TF and Graves, to give it a good send off.

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Midnight,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-08-03T18:32:43.902+0000)
>
> I made a similar post but it never caught any speed.
> 
> The other thing that is bothering me about it is that you can also choose to have Death's Daughter fire in your ult.
> 
> I guess I could see GP getting a new smaller ship (since the tool tip doesn't say that he signals the Deadpool, just "his ship") without announcing the fact that he is still alive. But he kicked Death's Daughter, his prized cannon (most people who hold something they have above any other like it, wouldn't be quick to give it's name to another after it's passing) , overboard as an execution for TF and Graves, to give it a good send off.

yea, its weird since he sank that cannon to the bottom of the bilgewater bay, when he tried to execute tf and graves.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackSunNocturne,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-08-03T17:31:30.617+0000)
>
> They mention that his flagship, the _Dead Pool_, was destroyed.
> 
> They never mentioned _**anything**_ about the Noxian (Swain's to be specific) flagship, the _Leviathan_..

this is actually a scary thought.
Holy cow. Now that you mentioned Graves. What about Destiny? His gun is on the bay floor with Death's Daughter.

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Midnight,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UF4iu0WY,comment-id=000900000000,timestamp=2015-08-03T18:52:38.628+0000)
>
> Holy cow. Now that you mentioned Graves. What about Destiny? His gun is on the bay floor with Death's Daughter.

Graves mentioned knowing someone in Piltover. I assume he forcefully acquired another gun.
Right. Forgot about that. Thanks.
confirmed visual update then?
That's how GP gets the Fire At Will Upgrade :P

you have to pay 500 silver searpents for it in game, so I believe we can interpret Gangplanks gameplay as a way to obtain the resources to outfit a new ship worthy of his reputation which would explain the different aspects of the ult he upgrades such as the number of canons, Deaths daughter, and the sails of his ship which raise morale. He is preparing for war with the entirety of Bilgewater
I didn't even begin to think of it like that. Thank you for the insight, I really like that line of thinking.

Is it in the jar of dirt?
http://sd.keepcalm-o-matic.co.uk/i/i-ve-got-a-jar-of-dirt-and-guess-what-s-inside-it.png
We NEED the jacksparrow gif of him walking onto shore just as his lil boat sinks.

inb4 Riot's response being: "*Well thats easy, it cant be the only ship he has*" to which i would reply: Yeah well if Death's Daughter is at the bottom of the bay, then where is his upgraded ult coming from?

He doesnt start the game with Death's Daughter. Once he gets 500 silver serpants, he can hire people to retrieve it for him. It actually makes more sense in-game than it did before - if he always had Death's Daughter, why does he have to pay to use it?
He turned in his doubloons to Blackheart.
